info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 05 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of east central Mineral and southwestern Missoula Counties through 330 PM MST... At 244 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower over Bonner-West Riverside, or 7 miles east of Missoula, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Visibility one-quarter mile or less. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Low visibility could result in dangerous driving conditions. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Alberton, Bonner-West Riverside, Wye, East Missoula, Frenchtown, Tarkio, Ninemile, Huson, Quartz and Cyr, Evaro Hill. This includes Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
